page.title: 10Farming:Hunton & Hauxwell
page.content: The farmland which covers most of this block supports 18 local families, but,because of modern farming methods, it gives full-time employment to only 28 men. Wives and children have their tasks, such as feeding calves, leading cows or helping at lambing, hay and harvest time. 12 farms keep{Friesian dairy cows,}on average 51 per herd. One Hauxwell man is proud of his Shorthorns.The milking parlours are normally operated by one labourer.Tankers collect the milk each day and take it to Northallerton. Cows are kept indoors in winter. They help themselves to silage from clamps with a self_feed face. Big{round bales}are the 'in-thing' this year. Bull calves, often bought as stores, are fattened indoors on barley by half the farmers and go for meat. Blewery Grange hires out three Hereford bulls to the Dales.
